snippet: Data being released for the first time shows that hospitals charge Medicare vastly differing amounts for the same procedures, often far above what the program typically reimburses.
abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services release data that shows hospitals charge Medicare wildly differing amounts for the same procedure, raising questions about how hospitals determine prices; data covers bills submitted from virtually every hospital in the United States in 2011 for the 100 most common treatments and procedures performed in hospitals.

byline.original: By BARRY MEIER, JO CRAVEN McGINTY and JULIE CRESWELL

lead_paragraph: Data being released for the first time shows that hospitals charge Medicare vastly differing amounts for the same procedures, often far above what the program typically reimburses.
